title: 'Police inactive and absent': What are key findings of HC-appointed panel on Murshidabad violence
content: A Calcutta high court-appointed committee has revealed significant failures by local authorities during the Murshidabad violence in Dhulian, pinpointing a local councillor's involvement in orchestrating the attacks on April 11. The report highlights the complete absence and inactivity of the local police during the unrest. Victims require tailored rehabilitation packages and appropriate compensation.

title: Denmark's largest construction company returns keys of Tesla cars
content: Danish construction firm Tscherning has divested its entire Tesla fleet, citing Elon Musk's political stances as the primary reason. This decision mirrors a broader trend in Europe, where Tesla's brand image and sales are suffering due to consumer concerns over Musk's political affiliations. The company is opting for European alternatives, highlighting the impact of political views on corporate purchasing decisions.

title: Bill Belichickâ€™s girlfriend Jordon Hudson reportedly told someone they are engaged
content: Bill Belichick and Jordon Hudson's relationship has captured public attention, and recent reports suggest they may be engaged. While neither Belichick nor Hudson have confirmed the news, fans have reacted strongly, expressing concerns about the couple's future and Belichick's assets. Belichick recently praised Hudson for her support, but the engagement rumors remain unconfirmed.

title: 10 minutes of fury: How Army flattened Pak posts after attack on civilians
content: Following Pakistan's ceasefire violation on May 7-8, the Indian Army retaliated swiftly along the LoC, destroying multiple Pakistani forward posts within 10 minutes using MMGs. Operation Sindoor was launched after the Pahalgam terror attack. An Indian soldier reported heavy casualties inflicted and bunkers destroyed. Pakistan then targeted civilian areas and attempted drone strikes, which were also neutralised by India.

title: IPL: Suryavanshi, Jurel and bowlers lead RR to six-wicket win over CSK
content: Rajasthan Royals capped off their IPL 2025 season with a commanding six-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings. Despite a brief middle-overs wobble, brilliant half-century from Vaibhav Suryavanshi and a blistering finish from Dhruv Jurel, coupled with a disciplined bowling effort led by Akash Madhwal, ensured the Royals chased down 188 with 17 balls to spare, ending their campaign on a high.

title: Everything Google announced at its biggest event of the yearEverything Google announced at its biggest event of the year
content: At I/O 2025, Google announced major AI-powered updates across its ecosystem. Highlights include Gemini 2.5â€™s Deep Think mode, AI-powered Search Mode, 3D video calls with Google Beam, Android XR smart glasses, and the $250/month AI Ultra plan. Here's a run-down of everything that was announced at Google I/O 2025.

title: America's biggest bank JPMorgan Chase to managers: Resist hiring, remember attrition is â€¦
content: JPMorgan Chase is implementing a hiring slowdown, prioritizing efficiency gains through artificial intelligence. The bank anticipates a 10% reduction in operations staff due to AI advancements in areas like fraud and payment processing. While overall headcount growth is being curbed, strategic hiring will continue in key areas such as banking, advising, and branch expansion.

title: Op Sindoor outreach: How govt chose 25 countries for all-party delegation briefings
content: Following Operation Sindoor, the Indian government is dispatching all-party parliamentary delegations to 25 key nations, including UNSC members and future members, starting May 23. This 10-day outreach aims to counter Pakistan's narrative on terrorism and present a united Indian front. Senior MPs will lead the delegations, emphasizing India's zero tolerance for terrorism and commitment to national security on global platforms.

title: 47 days of 47th US prez tariff-ying the world: How Trump reshaped global economy
content: Donald Trump's return to the White House has triggered global economic turmoil through aggressive tariffs and trade recalibrations. These measures have strained diplomatic ties, disrupted supply chains, and rattled financial markets, leading to warnings of stagnation from APEC and concerns from businesses like Walmart.

title: Big remittance hit: How Trumpâ€™s steps may cost India billions of dollars
content: India faces a potential remittance problem as the US tightens migration policies and proposes a 5% tax on remittances. This could significantly impact the $120 billion India receives annually, with the US being the largest contributor at $32 billion.

title: Social media has field day as Pak promotes Asim Munir to Field Marshal
content: Pakistan's promotion of General Asim Munir to Field Marshal, despite recent conflict with India, has sparked widespread mockery and disbelief. Social media users are questioning the basis for the honor, drawing comparisons to a past defeat and suggesting political motivations. The move is seen as ironic, with many highlighting Pakistan's military record and recent losses.

title: Watch: Vaibhav Suryavanshi touches MS Dhoniâ€™s feet after RR win over CSK
content: Following Rajasthan Royals' victory over Chennai Super Kings, young Vaibhav Suryavanshi, after a stellar 57-run innings, respectfully touched MS Dhoni's feet during post-match handshakes. This gesture, showcasing the enduring impact of Dhoni on the next generation, quickly gained traction on social media, highlighting the respect he commands even towards the twilight of his IPL career.

title: CSK equal embarrassing IPL record with loss against RR
content: Chennai Super Kings faced another setback in IPL 2025, suffering their 10th defeat, matching their worst record. Inconsistency and injuries plagued their campaign, dashing playoff hopes early. With one game left against Gujarat Titans, CSK risks setting a new record for most losses and potentially finishing last, needing a significant win to avoid the bottom spot.

title: 'Mowing the grass': Indiaâ€™s missiles now live in terroristsâ€™ minds
content: Operation Sindoor, India's assertive response to the Pahalgam massacre, involved coordinated strikes deep inside Pakistan, targeting terrorist infrastructure. Unlike previous actions, it aimed to inflict material costs, degrading terrorist capabilities and challenging Pakistan's military-terrorist nexus. This operation signifies a shift in India's strategic thinking towards routine, calibrated retaliation, signaling a new normal where military responses against terrorism are prioritized.

title: IPL 2025 Points Table: Latest standings after CSK vs RR match
content: Vaibhav Suryavanshi, the 14-year-old prodigy, propelled Rajasthan Royals to a six-wicket victory over Chennai Super Kings in their final IPL 2025 match. Suryavanshi's explosive 57 off 33 balls, coupled with Sanju Samson's 41, ensured RR chased down CSK's 188 with ease. While RR finished ninth, the playoff race intensifies with Mumbai Indians and Delhi Capitals battling for the final spot.

title: SC to petitioners on waqf law: Need 'strong and glaring' case for relief
content: The Supreme Court has asked petitioners challenging the waqf laws to present a compelling case for interim relief, emphasizing the presumption of constitutionality for statutes. Petitioners argue the law enables systematic expropriation of waqf properties, dilutes Muslim representation, and restricts legal remedies.

title: Carlsen vs World: When the No. 1 chess player took on 143,000 people
content: Magnus Carlsen recently faced a unique challenge, battling over 143,000 chess enthusiasts worldwide in a freestyle game hosted online. This marked the first time a reigning or former world champion participated in such a format. Despite predictions favouring Carlsen, Team World played strategically, leading to a draw by move 32 via threefold repetition.

title: Gold smuggling case: Actress Ranya Rao gets bail, but to remain in jail
content: Ranya Rao and Tarun Raju secured default bail from a Bengaluru court in a gold smuggling case due to the DRI's delayed chargesheet filing. Despite this, Ranya remains detained under the COFEPOSA Act. The case involves the seizure of smuggled gold worth crores and multiple Dubai trips, leading to charges under the Customs Act and investigations into financial violations.

title: 'Math not mathing': Dale Steyn rips into CSK after top-order collapse
content: Dale Steyn criticised Chennai Super Kings' team management for their questionable batting order decisions in the IPL 2025 match against Rajasthan Royals. He questioned promoting bowlers like Ashwin and Jadeja ahead of power-hitters, as CSK struggled to 78/5. Dhoni admitted the team is now focused on preparing for the 2026 season after their elimination.

title: Musk says Tesla 'doing well'; promises less political spending in future
content: Elon Musk affirmed his commitment to remain Tesla's CEO for at least five more years, dismissing concerns over political backlash stemming from his association with Donald Trump. . â€œIn terms of political spending, Iâ€™m going to do a lot less in the future," he said. Despite past sales dips and protests, Tesla's market capitalization has rebounded, exceeding a trillion dollars.

title: MS Dhoniâ€™s doppelganger steals spotlight at CSK vs RR clash in Delhi
content: Even though the Chennai Super Kings and Rajasthan Royals match was inconsequential, a spectator resembling MS Dhoni stole the show. Cameras frequently focused on the doppelganger during the CSK innings, creating a buzz among fans. This unexpected attraction served as a potent reminder of Dhoni's enduring influence and iconic status within the franchise, overshadowing the game itself.

title: Robert Griffin III-Ryan Clark feud explodes over Angel Reese & Caitlin Clark drama
content: The debate between RG3 and Ryan Clark began as a basic sports opinion but evolved to become personal. RG3 feels that Angel Reese despises Caitlin Clark, whereas Clark feels that the media is creating a rivalry. The brawl took a bigger turn when Clark brought RG3's family into it. Both men are now digging in their heels, and the world of sports is observing closely.

title: Pak govt promotes army chief Asim Munir to field marshal
content: In a surprising move, the Pakistan government has promoted General Asim Munir to the rank of field marshal, a decision made during a cabinet meeting led by Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif. This elevation follows recent tensions, including India's precision strikes on terrorist spots and thwarted Pakistani drone attacks, culminating in a ceasefire agreement between the two nations.

title: Covid cases surge in Singapore & Hong Kong: Key symptoms of variants
content: COVID-19 cases are sharply increasing in parts of Asia, particularly Singapore and Hong Kong, driven by the fast-spreading subvariants LF.7 and NB.1.8, descendants of JN.1. The rise is attributed to increased transmissibility, waning immunity, and relaxed preventive measures.

title: Can Yuki Bhambri lead India's challenge in French Open 2025?
content: Yuki Bhambri, now India's No. 2 doubles player, is navigating a challenging clay court season leading up to Roland Garros. Despite inconsistent partnerships and early exits in recent tournaments, Bhambri remains focused on improving his performance and aiming for success at the upcoming Grand Slam events. He also acknowledges Rohan Bopanna's significant contribution to Indian tennis.

title: 'It's in our control': Jayawardene backs MI to seal IPL playoff berth
content: Mumbai Indians' head coach Mahela Jayawardene is confident about their playoff chances after a strong winning streak. They face Delhi Capitals in a crucial match, needing a win to secure their spot. Jayawardene emphasised focusing on routines and praised the team's resilience in must-win situations, with replacements ready for departing overseas players.

title: HI official clears the air on Pak's participation in Asia Cup hockey in India
content: Amid heightened tensions following the Pahalgam attack, Hockey India will adhere to the government's decision regarding Pakistan's participation in the upcoming Asia Cup, scheduled in Rajgir. Bholanath Singh, Hockey India's secretary general, emphasised that the country's interests take precedence. While the Pakistan Hockey Federation has requested visa guarantees, Hockey India awaits government directives, prioritising the nation's honour above all else.

title: 'Answers for next year': Dhoni looks ahead to IPL 2026 after CSK's exit
content: Captain MS Dhoni acknowledged Chennai Super Kings' early exit from IPL 2025, stating the team is now focused on experimenting and planning for the next season, particularly improving their bowling. Despite the disappointing season, Dhoni emphasised the franchise isn't under pressure and is looking at combinations for a rebuild for next year.

title: IPL 2025 playoffs schedule announced: Final to be held in Ahmedabad
content: The BCCI has announced the schedule and venues for the IPL 2025 playoffs. New PCA Stadium in New Chandigarh will host Qualifier 1 on May 29 and the Eliminator on May 30. Ahmedabad's Narendra Modi Stadium will then host Qualifier 2 on June 1 and the final on June 3.

title: Truth Berns: How Democrats became undemocratic
content: The Democratic Party, it seems, ceased being fully democratic well before Donald Trump ever stepped behind a teleprompter. The internal erosion began in the Obama era and became painfully clear in the 2016 primaries, when Sanders ran an insurgent campaign powered by small-dollar donors and grassroots mobilisation. Despite winning multiple states, Sanders found himself outmanoeuvred by a party establishment aligned with Hillary Clinton, aided by unelected superdelegates and a Democratic National Committee (DNC) whose neutrality was seriously in question.

title: Akshay Kumar to sue Paresh Rawal over Hera Pheri 3 exit: Top 5 news
content: Showbiz is buzzing with news! Siddhant Chaturvedi and Sara Tendulkar's rumored romance ended swiftly, while Mukesh Rishi defended Salman Khan's friendly nature. The 'War 2' teaser dropped, showcasing Hrithik Roshan and Jr NTR's epic clash. Akshay Kumar is reportedly suing Paresh Rawal for â‚¹25 crore over his 'Hera Pheri 3' exit.

title: Senior Jharkhand IAS officer arrested in liquor scam case
content: Jharkhand IAS officer Vinay Kumar Choubey was arrested by Chhattisgarh's anti-corruption bureau in connection with a liquor scam. An FIR was filed against Choubey for allegedly causing financial losses to Jharkhand's exchequer by altering the state's liquor policy. The syndicate allegedly manipulated tender norms to favor certain companies, earning illegal commissions.

title: YouTuber, trader, student, security guard: 12 'spies' come from all walks of life
content: Indian authorities have arrested at least 12 individuals across Punjab, Haryana, and Uttar Pradesh for alleged espionage linked to Pakistan. The suspects, including a YouTuber, are accused of sharing sensitive information with Pakistani Intelligence Operatives. Investigations revealed contact with a Pakistani official at the Pakistan High Commission in Delhi, who has since been expelled.

title: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan at Cannes Film Festival with Aaradhya- Watch
content: Aishwarya Rai Bachchan has arrived at the Cannes Film Festival 2025 with her daughter, Aaradhya Bachchan, greeted warmly at Nice airport. Aishwarya sported a navy blue trench coat, while Aaradhya wore a black coat. The actress previously shared that Aaradhya enjoys Cannes for its familiar and sociable atmosphere, feeling at home amidst the celebration of cinema.

title: Tataâ€™s this move to help Apple diversify awayfromChina
content: Tata Electronics has initiated iPhone assembly, including the iPhone 16 series, at its Hosur facility, a move that may challenge Foxconn's dominance in the smartphone supply chain.

title: 'United in fight against terrorism': PM Modi speaks to German Chancellor Merz
content: Prime Minister Narendra Modi has congratulated Friedrich Merz on becoming the new Chancellor of Germany, as both leaders committed to strengthening the strategic partnership between India and Germany. They exchanged perspectives on global and regional issues, reinforcing their united stance against terrorism. Merz's election followed a historic second-round victory, marking him as Germany's 10th chancellor since World War II.

title: NBA conference finals: Everything to know about Knicks-Pacers, Thunder-Wolves series
content: With the NBA Finals just a round away, our experts break down how each team got here and what we are hearing about each series.

title: Eagles downplay tush push import as vote looms
content: With a vote coming Wednesday that could ban the tush push, a pair of prominent Philadelphia Eagles players downplayed the significance of the play.

title: NFL players OK'd to play flag in 2028 Olympics
content: NFL owners have approved a proposal for players to participate in flag football at the 2028 Los Angeles Olympics.

title: Unanimous choice Castle heads All-Rookie team
content: Spurs guard Stephon Castle was the only unanimous choice for the NBA's All-Rookie first-team, which also included Zaccharie Risacher, Jaylen Wells, Zach Edey and Alex Sarr.

title: Jeanty: OC wants me to ditch 'Halloween' stance
content: Raiders rookie Ashton Jeanty says that offensive coordinator Chip Kelly wants him to adjust his pre-snap stance.

title: Burrow: Another night game at Ravens 'isn't ideal'
content: Bengals quarterback Joe Burrow made a tongue-in-cheek suggestion for the NFL to give Cincinnati a home night game vs. the Ravens in 2026.

title: Gretzky celebrates Stars, coy on series vs. Oilers
content: Wayne Gretzky visited the Stars locker room after Dallas' series-clinching win but avoided picking against his former team, the Oilers, whom the Stars will face next in the Western Conference final.

title: Kinda, ex-Sporting Kansas City player, dies at 31
content: Former Sporting Kansas City midfielder Gadi Kinda died, his club Maccabi Haifa FC announced Tuesday. He was 31.

title: Arkansas' Fland to join reigning champion Gators
content: Arkansas transfer Boogie Fland has committed to the Florida Gators, the defending NCAA champions, Fland told ESPN on Tuesday.

title: ðŸ†• Predicting Rounds 1 and 2 of the NBA draft
content: After Cooper Flagg, the draft could get interesting. Here's how ESPN's Jonathan Givony and Jeremy Woo see it playing out.

title: Are the A's really playoff contenders?! An early verdict on MLB's most surprising teams
content: We offer an early postseason verdict on five of MLB's most surprising teams almost two months into the 2025 season.

title: NBA conference finals horoscopes: Which teams are poised to ascend, and which will go in retrograde?
content: What does the Zodiac have to say about the Knicks, Thunder, Pacers and Wolves? Neil Paine shares his reading.

title: WNBA Power Rankings: Minnesota on top, Golden State at the bottom in Week 1
content: Minnesota, New York and Indiana are 1-2-3 in Week 1, but which team climbed eight spots from our preseason rankings?

title: Chaos awaits in stacked SEC baseball tournament
content: For the very first time, all 16 SEC teams will get to participate in this year's conference baseball tournament.

title: The NFL is excited about Olympic flag football, but will its stars participate? Not everyone is on board
content: A vote Tuesday paved the way for players such as Patrick Mahomes and Tyreek Hill to play Olympic flag football.

title: No QBs allowed: We name the 25 best non-QB players for 2025
content: It's not all about quarterbacks. These players could have a big impact on 2025, even if they don't throw a pass.

title: Latest Bracketology: UConn emerges as a No. 1 seed for 2025-26
content: With Alex Karaban among the returning players, the Huskies crack the top line of our latest projected field.

title: Five fringe players who deserve a call-up for USMNT Gold Cup team
content: With results far from convincing, the USMNT needs fresh blood. Could these players get minutes at the Gold Cup?

title: Which Europa League finalist has had a worse season: Man United or Spurs?
content: Man United and Spurs have both had historically bad seasons but, somehow, one of them will win a European trophy and qualify for the Champions League.

title: How to bet tennis Grand Slams: The wagers you can make and ones to avoid
content: Tennis betting analyst Pam Maldonado reveals her strategies and tips for wagering on Grand Slam tournaments heading into the French Open.

title: Where things stand for each Ryder Cup team after two majors
content: Which players are locks to make each team? What tough decisions will captains Keegan Bradley and Luke Donald have to make? We break down how each team is shaping up.

title: NBA playoff futures: Thunder favored to win championship, followed by Knicks
content: An updated listing of the odds to win the NBA championship and Finals MVP heading into the conference finals.

title: Stanley Cup playoff odds: Panthers slight East favorites
content: Every playoff team's odds to win the 2025 Stanley Cup and favorites for the Conn Smythe Trophy for playoff MVP.

title: Poch: Turner risks being replaced as USMNT No. 1
content: USMNT head coach Mauricio Pochettino said that he is open to giving playing time to another goalkeeper besides incumbent Matt Turner in upcoming matches ahead of the 2026 World Cup.

title: City back in top 4 as KDB bids farewell to Etihad
content: Manchester City gave Kevin De Bruyne a victory in his final appearance at Etihad Stadium, as Omar Marmoush, Bernardo Silva and Nico Gonzalez scored in a 3-1 Premier League win over Bournemouth on Tuesday that saw them climb to third in the table.

title: Sources: GuimarÃ£es targeted by Saudi champs
content: Newcastle United midfielder Bruno GuimarÃ£es is in the sights of Al Ittihad over a potential â‚¬120 million ($135 million) transfer, sources confirmed to ESPN Brasil.

title: Rodri makes Man City return after ACL injury
content: Midfielder Rodri is back in the Manchester City squad for the first time since having surgery on his ACL in September.

title: Amorim: 'Hard to explain' pressure on Postecoglou
content: Ruben Amorim said it's "hard to explain" why he is not under the same pressure at Manchester United as his Tottenham counterpart Ange Postecoglou ahead of the Europa League final despite both teams suffering similarly miserable Premier League campaigns.

title: Sources: Clubs sue Liga MX for pro/rel return
content: Mexican second division clubs from the Liga de ExpansiÃ³n have filed a lawsuit against Liga MX and the Mexican Football Federation (FMF) regarding the return of promotion of relegation, sources told ESPN.

title: Sources: United closing in on $83M Cunha deal
content: Manchester United are growing increasingly confident that they will land Matheus Cunha from Wolves this summer, sources have told ESPN.

title: Transfer rumors, news: Arsenal, Chelsea in for Gordon
content: Arsenal and Chelsea remain interested in signing Newcastle United winger Anthony Gordon. Transfer Talk has the latest news, gossip and rumors.

title: Denver's biggest summer priority, plus offseason guides for every NBA team
content: NBA front office insider Bobby Marks breaks down the summer priorities and needs for every eliminated team.

title: Waiver wire: NL Central southpaws lead top picks
content: Eric Karabell outlines the players you should be claiming off the waiver wire and who you should be dropping from fantasy rosters.

title: Maharashtra's Palghar Collector Office Receives Fake Bomb Threat Email
content: The collector's office in Maharashtra's Palghar received a bomb threat email in the early hours of Tuesday, prompting the police to evacuate the premises, officials said.

title: Two Arrested For Hacking Websites, Posting Anti-India Message In Gujarat
content: The Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) has caught two persons, including a minor, for allegedly hacking Indian websites and posting anti-India messages online, officials said on Tuesday.

title: Ahead Of Indian Astronaut's Space Odyssey, A Global Outreach
content: India and the US are using the upcoming NASA-ISRO joint flight of an Indian astronaut to space as a big outreach activity between the world's oldest and world's largest democracies.

title: Fallen Trees, Flooded Underpasses: Heavy Rain Causes Chaos In Mumbai
content: Unseasonal heavy rainfall, accompanied with gusty winds, thunderstorms and lightning, in parts of Maharashtra, including Mumbai and Pune, brought much-need relief from the scorching heat but triggered widespread water logging and traffic chaos.

title: 6 Killed As Building Slab Crashes Through Four Floors In Maharashtra's Kalyan
content: Six people, including four women and a two-year-old child, were killed and four others were injured after a slab of the top floor of a four-storey building in Kalyan collapsed on the lower floors in a cascading effect on Tuesday afternoon.

title: Why GenZ Is Sharing Personal Data With Companies Willingly
content: A significant portion of Gen Z is open to sharing personal data, with 88% willing to share information with social media companies in exchange for incentives. This demographic shift is changing the way companies approach data collection.

title: Trump Signs 'Take It Down' Act Criminalising Revenge Porn And Deepfakes
content: The new law makes it a federal crime to "knowingly publish" or threaten to publish intimate images without consent, including AI-generated "deepfakes", and requires social media companies to remove such content within 48 hours of a victim's request.

title: Maharashtra Names Chief Justice "Permanent Guest" Days After Protocol Lapse
content: The Maharashtra government has issued protocol guidelines to ensure adherence to the official decorum during the visit of the Chief Justice of India to Mumbai and other parts of the state.

title: After Minister's Call, Uddhav Thackeray's Party Extends Support To Anti-Terror Outreach
content: Days after it raised a call for boycotting all-party delegations, the Shiv Sena (UBT) on Tuesday said the party would support India's global outreach on terror in the "national interest" after Union Minister Kiren Rijiju called up Uddhav Thackeray.

title: Calls For Probe Rise After State Name On Manipur Government Bus Forced To Be Covered
content: Journalists from Imphal valley turned back midway while going to Ukhrul district to attend the state-level Shirui Lily Festival after the security forces covered the word 'Manipur' on the windshield of a state-run bus in which they were travelling.

title: Congress Office In Turkey? Party Sues Amit Malviya, Journalist For Defamation
content: The Congress has filed a police case against the BJP's Amit Malviya and Editor-in-Chief of Republic, Arnab Goswami.

title: To SBI Manager's "This Is India" Remark, Customer's "Kannada First" Reply
content: An SBI Bank Manager in Bengaluru refused to speak in Kannada, Karnataka's official language, as a customer kept insisting and reminding her that "this is Karnataka", sparking the language row.

title: Tirumala Tirupati Temple To Use Anti-Drone Technology For Security
content: The Tirumala Tirupati Devasthanam (TTD) has decided to use anti-drone technology in view of the threat perception to Sri Venkateswara temple, the world's richest Hindu temple.

title: Iran's Khamenei Fed Up With Trump's "Nonsense" Demands, Defers Future Talks
content: Iran's Supreme Leader Ayatollah Ali Khamenei has let his displeasure about Donald Trump and the US administration's demands in the crucial nuclear talks be known publicly, calling them nonsensical and utterly outrageous.

title: In Outreach Delegations' Briefing, Pak's 'Victim Card', China's Changed Stand
content: The foreign ministry briefing for the all-party delegations that are going to visit more than 30 nations to explain Operation Sindoor and India's resolve to end terror, has focussed on the US claims on ceasefire and the changed stance of China.

title: No Handshake, No Sweets: Low-Key Beating Retreat Ceremony Resumes At Attari
content: After 12 days, the beating retreat ceremony resumed on Tuesday at the joint check post of the Punjab Frontier, Attari in Amritsar.

title: In YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra's Diary, Takeaways From Her 10 Days In Pakistan
content: YouTuber Jyoti Malhotra, who has several videos on her social media handles detailing her trips to Pakistan, has been hitting headlines for all the wrong reasons.

title: Investors Kidnap Stock Trader In Odisha After Losing Money In Market Downturn
content: A group of investors allegedly kidnapped a stock market trader from Odisha's Cuttack after he failed to repay them their money, police said.

title: Elon Musk Says Will Spend A 'Lot Less' On Political Campaigns
content: Billionaire Elon Musk said Tuesday he was pulling back from spending his fortune on politics, asserting his Tesla electric car company was doing well despite blowback over his support of US President Donald Trump.

title: Heavy Rains Likely In Parts Of Maharashtra In Next 4 Days: Weather Office
content: Parts of Maharashtra may witness heavy rain with thunder and gusty winds between May 21 and 24, following a cyclonic circulation which is likely to form over the east-central Arabian Sea off the Karnataka coast, the Met department said on Tuesday.
